memberdef.definition: typedef wiced_bool_t(* wiced_bt_mesh_model_handle_cb_t) (uint8_t element_idx, uint16_t src_id, uint16_t app_key_idx, uint8_t ttl, uint16_t opcode, const uint8_t *params, uint16_t params_len)
memberdef.argsstring: )(uint8_t element_idx, uint16_t src_id, uint16_t app_key_idx, uint8_t ttl, uint16_t opcode, const uint8_t *params, uint16_t params_len)
memberdef.name: wiced_bt_mesh_model_handle_cb_t

briefdescription.para: Callback from the Transition procedure that the values have been updated Parameters: p_present Array of present values.

detaileddescription.para: Sizeof the array is the same as when transaction was started ref_data Pinter as passed to the transaction start remaining_time Remaining time in the transition. If 0, the transition is completed and this is the last time the callback is executed.

briefdescription.para: Converts the given encoded transition time value in to the units of SMART_MESH_APP_FINE_TIMEOUT_IN_MS.

detaileddescription.para: Parameters: trans_time :Encoded transition time value as defined in model spec Return :value in number of fine timer ticks. Returns zero for invalid value

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of fine timer ticks from the power-up.

detaileddescription.para: Return : Number of app ine timer ticks

briefdescription.para: Converts the given opcode to the corresponding byte stream Note: It does not check the validity of the opcode.

detaileddescription.para: Parameters: *p: Pointer to the stream buffer op: 1/2/3 byte opcode Return: pointer to the next empty location in the stream buffer after adding opcode bytes

briefdescription.para: Converts the given transition time in milliseconds to correctly encoded value as per the mesh spec Parameters: time_ms : Transition time in milliseconds.

detaileddescription.para: Note, final transition time accuracy will depend upon the length of the time.

briefdescription.para: Initialize mesh transition server Parameters: element_idx Index of the element of the device p_ref_data Reference data to be returned in the callback.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t element_idx, uint32_t transition_time, uint32_t delay, uint32_t *target, uint32_t *present, uint32_t num_values, wiced_bt_mesh_transition_callback_t *p_callback, void *p_ref_data)
memberdef.name: mesh_server_transition_start

briefdescription.para: Start the Transition procedure Parameters: element_idx Index of the element of the device transition_time Transition time in milliseconds delay Delay before starting the transition target Array of the target values to transition to present Array of the present values to transition from num_values Number of elements in the Target and Present arrays p_callback Callback to be executed on the transition process and when transition is completed p_ref_data Reference data to be returned in the callback.
Stop the Transition procedure.

detaileddescription.para: The transition server will callback to the parent to indicated current state. Parameters: element_idx Index of the element of the device

briefdescription.para: Start the Transition procedure Parameters: element_idx Index of the element of the device.
Return the value of the default transition time set for the element in milliseconds.

parameterdescription.para: Index of the element on the device

briefdescription.para: Registers the given SIG model handler into the list of handlers to be called during opcode processing.
This function can be called to cancel sending of the current message.

detaileddescription.para: If request is in the queue, the callback is executed.

briefdescription.para: This function can be called to check if message with one of the opcodes is in the queue for transmission.
This request can be used to cancel outstanding writes to a specific destination from the specific queue.

memberdef.argsstring: (wiced_bt_mesh_event_t *p_event, wiced_bt_mesh_event_t **p_out_event, wiced_bool_t is_command, uint16_t opcode, uint8_t *p_buffer, uint16_t len, wiced_bt_mesh_core_send_complete_callback_t complete_callback)
memberdef.name: wiced_bt_mesh_models_utils_send

briefdescription.para: This function can be called send message through the core.

detaileddescription.para: The function keeps track of the output event and executes provided callback if message is not canceled.

parameterdescription.para: Fully prepared wiced_bt_mesh_event_t structure with information on where and how event should be sent
Pointer to the queue of the events sent by the current modules. The pointer shall not be null if there is callback
If true the packet a command originated by the current device. Based on this parameter core selects different value for random delay before the packet is scheduled for transmission.
Pointer to the data to be sent out.
Size of the data to be sent out. The maximum length is about 377 bytes (depends on the size of the opcode).

The pointer to the callback to be executed when the packet is queued for the transmission. If parameter is null, the core assumes the application releases the ownership of the p_event. If not null, application shall release the p_event, typically in the contents of the callback.

briefdescription.para: This function can be called to extend reply timeout, for example, when a friend has replied on behalf of an LPN.

parameterdescription.para: event that has been used in initial wiced_bt_mesh_models_utils_send function

briefdescription.para: The access layer has completed sending of the packet.

detaileddescription.para: Returns TRUE if event was dequeued. FALSE if timer is still running and another complete will follow when timer expires.

briefdescription.para: Cancel all send requests.
Return the value of the OnPowerUp state.

parameterdescription.para: Index of the element on the device
Pointer to the variable to be filled with current on power up state.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t element_idx, uint16_t actual_target, uint16_t linear_target, uint32_t lux_level_current, uint32_t lux_level_target, uint32_t transition_time, uint32_t delay)
